newsitem.title: USA: Handleman says seeing benefits of efforts.
newsitem.headline: Handleman says seeing benefits of efforts.

text.p: Handleman Co said on Thursday it was beginning to see results from its efforts to increase sales and cut inventories and operating expenses.

"We are beginning to see the benefits of the strategic initiatives the company has implemented to improve sales as well as reduce inventory and operating expenses," said Stephen Strome, president and chief executive officer, in a statement accompanying earnings. "These efforts should help the company in its recovery period. Our endeavors to improve performance continue unabated."
Handleman reported earnings for the second quarter ended October 26 of $0.20 per share, up from $0.10 a year earlier. Net sales rose 18 percent to $347.1 million.
The company has three operating units: Handleman Entertainment Resources, North Coast Entertainment and International.

It said higher music sales stemmed from improved sales to major customers through more promotional activity, and it linked the higher level of video sales to increased sales of "mega-hit" releases and fewer customer product returns.

Gains in book sales resulted mainly from new store openings with a major customer, while a drop in personal computer software sales stemmed from efforts to realign inventories with key customers to better reflect retail selling patterns, it said.
Handleman supplies and merchandises music, video, book and personal computer software products to North American retail chains.
